title: THE ENTREPRENEUR - BUILDING BUSINESSES THROUGH RECOVERY AND PANDEMIC (2013-2022)
description: Co-founding Clownfish creative agency and Koralium organic food, navigating recovery, political upheaval, and COVID-19

timeline.description: Launched creative agency specializing in branding, web design, and marketing during Spain's worst crisis
Building client base from scratch in a devastated market, hustling for every project
Launched organic food supermarket, diversifying into retail alongside the agency
Managing two businesses simultaneously: creative services and organic retail
Clownfish surpasses 100+ projects; Koralium reaches 500+ SKUs; Spain's economy recovering
Spain enters one of Europe's strictest lockdowns; both businesses severely impacted
Pivoting to digital, adapting Koralium to delivery, Clownfish shifts to online marketing
After 9 years of Clownfish and 7 years of Koralium, both businesses concluded

phases.name: Early Recovery
phases.description: Spain slowly emerges from crisis. Austerity continues. New political parties disrupt the system. Entrepreneurship grows out of necessity.

phases.name: Sustained Growth
phases.description: Tourism-driven recovery, job creation returns but precarious. Political instability with repeated elections. Catalonia crisis.

phases.name: Pandemic and Recovery
phases.description: COVID-19 devastates Spain's economy (-11.3% GDP). Strictest lockdown in Europe. Then rapid recovery fueled by EU funds.

governments.name: Pedro Sanchez (PSOE)
governments.context: Motion of no confidence, coalition government, pandemic management

smallBusinessSurvival.title: Small Business 5-Year Survival Rate in Spain (%)

keyEvents.description: After 39 years, the king abdicates in favor of his son Felipe VI amid declining popularity and scandals
New political parties shatter Spain's two-party system; end of bipartisanship between PP and PSOE
Illegal referendum, declaration of independence, Article 155 invoked; Spain's biggest constitutional crisis in decades
Spain enters state of alarm March 14; one of the strictest lockdowns worldwide; 98 days of confinement
Spain achieves one of Europe's highest vaccination rates (90%+); economy rebounds 5.5%

entrepreneurshipInSpain.title: Entrepreneurship Landscape During the Period
challenges: Spain consistently ranked among EU's hardest countries to start a business
Social security costs for self-employed (autonomos) averaged 280 EUR/month minimum
Average time to open a business: 14 bureaucratic steps
Access to credit nearly impossible for small businesses post-2008

funFacts: Starting a business in Spain during 26% unemployment was either brave or crazy - probably both
The phrase 'emprendedor' (entrepreneur) became Spain's most overused buzzword in 2013
Organic food went from 'hippie niche' to mainstream during this period
COVID turned every business owner into an improvised IT manager overnight
Spain's lockdown was so strict that children couldn't go outside for 42 consecutive days
The ERTE furlough scheme saved an estimated 3.4 million jobs during the pandemic
Zoom went from unknown to essential vocabulary in approximately 2 weeks
Running two businesses simultaneously meant the concept of 'weekends' was purely theoretical
